result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared John Kuczer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: No contact with victim, Mr. Ryan Parsons, unless the contact permitted by probation agent.
Eligible upon successful completion of probation.

Provide DNA sample.
If Agent requests early release from probation, the court will sign the order.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jared John Kuczer

( copy of) Letter from Atty Robinson to Mr Parson re: payment of restitution and no contact provision.
Ryan T Parsons

2:57  Defendant Jared John Kuczer in court with attorney Nila Robinson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie amend to  940.19(1) Misdemeanor battery  S/W  Prob 1 yr with court costs  Expungment if successfully completes.  Defense agrees Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the amended charge misdemeanor battery  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the amended charge misdemeanor battery.Restitution has been paid in full.    Court orders S/W Probation 1 year. Conditions:  Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, no contact with the victim Mr. Ryan Parsons unless the contact is permitted by probation agent. If agent requests early release from probation the court will sign the order   If defendant  successfully completes sentence expungment will be granted.

from Atty Robinson re: requesting to appear telephonically for status conference. The case is not settled. ***Handwritten note states a piece of mail was opened this morning containing an offer which may be acceptable. Will communicate with client and advise the court.

Court approves case to be set for status conference. 2:21

10:15   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant. Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.   Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing.   Not guilty plea received by the court.   The bond will continue as ordered and is reviewed with the defendant.   Pretrial Conference to be set with Judicial Assistant. Attorney Robinson requests to appear via phone for the pre-trial conference, both defendant and Attorney Robinson are allowed to appear via phone.  Thorie agrees.  Attorney Robinson to place call. 10:19

10:12Defendant Jared John Kuczer in court with Attorney Nila Robinson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.   Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
LN
Preliminary hearing at 02-16-2016 10:00 am
Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to his time requirements.

3:44 Defendant Jared John Kuczer in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court with Def.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant. Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Thorie: $2000 signature bond. Nelson has no objection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
